alert.note: Alert for Winston (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 11 at 4:00PM CDT until May 11 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM CDT FOR CHOCTAW...WINSTON AND WEBSTER COUNTIES... At 359 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Slate Springs to near Ackerman to near Noxapater, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. At 320 PM, downed trees were reported in Winona. At 330 PM, a tree was downed near Kilmichael. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Reform around 405 PM CDT. Mantee around 440 PM CDT. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for east central Mississippi. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
